summary: Gaeton J. Fonzi was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Fonzi as an employee. These reports detail his salary and employment dates within the SCAS during 1978. Specifically, he is listed in payroll certifications for April and August 1978, as well as a certification report for December 1978.
significance: The significance of Gaeton J. Fonzi lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documents suggest he was a staff member during a portion of the committee's active investigation period.
